meanings.definition: To breathe noisily and repeatedly through the nose due to a cold or crying.
meanings.sent1: When I have a cold, I sniffle a lot.
meanings.sent2: She would sniffle softly when she felt sad.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would sniffle cutely when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees sniffle as if they were catching a cold.
meanings.sent5: The old man's sniffle echoed through the quiet room.

meanings.definition: A slight, sniffing sound, as in crying or sniffling.
meanings.sent1: I heard a little sniffle coming from the next room.
meanings.sent2: Her sniffle was barely audible over the music.
meanings.sent3: The sniffle of the baby made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The sniffle of the engine signaled a problem.
meanings.sent5: The sniffle of the wind through the leaves was calming.
